task.title: Override Variables
task.shortdesc: Variables declared in the configuration file can be overridden a post's YAML Front Matter. This lets data be cusomized based on the content the reader is viewing.

context.p: Overridden variables are only changed for the individual post. For an example, if a post is written by a new author, the author variable may need to be overridden with the new author's name. All other posts will retain the default author's name.

step.cmd: Be sure you have your default variable declared, as described in
Create your post, as described in
In the YAML Front Matter of the post created in step 2, write the name of the variable. Set it equal to the value desired for this post.
step.stepxmp:
An variable named backgroundColor set to be red would look like this in the YAML Front Matter:
--- backgroundColor: red ---
step.stepresult: When viewing this post on the website, the post should reflect the changed setting. This changed setting will not be reflected on other posts.
